Request of multivariate anomaly detection.

Docs.summary: Detect Multivariate Anomaly.
Docs.returns: To be added.
Docs.remarks: Submit multivariate anomaly detection task with the modelId of trained model and inference data, the input schema should be the same with the training request. The request will complete asynchronously and return a resultId to query the detection result.The request should be a source link to indicate an externally accessible Azure storage Uri, either pointed to an Azure blob storage folder, or pointed to a CSV file in Azure blob storage.
Docs.exception: or is null.
is an empty string, and was expected to be non-empty.

Docs.param: Method of univariate anomaly detection.
The cancellation token to use.
Docs.summary: Detect anomalies for the entire series in batch.
Docs.returns: To be added.
Docs.remarks: This operation generates a model with an entire series, each point is detected with the same model. With this method, points before and after a certain point are used to determine whether it is an anomaly. The entire detection can give user an overall status of the time series.
Docs.exception: is null.

Docs.param: Model information.
The cancellation token to use.
Docs.summary: Train a Multivariate Anomaly Detection Model.
Docs.returns: To be added.
Docs.remarks: Create and train a multivariate anomaly detection model. The request must include a source parameter to indicate an externally accessible Azure blob storage URI.There are two types of data input: An URI pointed to an Azure blob storage folder which contains multiple CSV files, and each CSV file contains two columns, timestamp and variable. Another type of input is an URI pointed to a CSV file in Azure blob storage, which contains all the variables and a timestamp column.
Docs.exception: is null.
